biography.bio: Roger Pierre was born on August 30, 1923 in Paris, France as Jean Le Gall. He was an actor and writer, known for My American Uncle (1980), La grande farandole (1961) and Les motards (1959). He died on January 23, 2010 in Le Port-Marly, Yvelines, France.
biography.name: Roger Pierre

biography.bio: Jean-Marc Thibault was born on August 24, 1923 in Saint-Bris-Le-Vineux, Yonne, Bourgogne, France. He is an actor and writer, known for Vidocq (2001), Mademoiselle Chambon (2009) and Féroce (2002). He has been married to Sophie Agacinski since July 9, 1983. They have one child. He was previously married to Madeleine Findeling.
biography.name: Jean-Marc Thibault

biography.bio: Darry Cowl was born on August 27, 1925 in Vittel, Vosges, Lorraine, France as André Darricau. He was an actor and composer, known for Not on the Lips (2003), Archimède, le clochard (1959) and Les misérables (1995). He was married to Rolande Kalis and Nelly Marco. He died on February 14, 2006 in Neuilly-sur-Seine, Hauts-de-Seine, Ile-de-France, France.
biography.name: Darry Cowl

biography.bio: Francis Blanche was born on July 20, 1921 in Paris, France as Francis Jean Blanche. He was an actor, known for Monsieur Gangster (1963), Belle de Jour (1967) and The Great Spy Chase (1964). He died on July 6, 1974 in Paris.
biography.name: Francis Blanche

biography.bio: Henri Salvador got a real chance to aim to fame when he got hired by orchestra leader Ray Ventura after years of cabarets, little jobs and military service. When Ray Ventura and his band went to play in Brazil during World War II, Henri Salvador became popular over there as a singer and funnyman. Back in France after the war ended, Henri Salvador left Ray Ventura behind and started a career of is own. His first record, which included "Clopin-Clopant" and "Maladie d'Amour" (covered by the Ames Brothers as "Mélodie d'Amour") became an instant hit. Salvador, at 83, is still popular after many hits, whether they're humorous songs ("Faut rigoler", "Je peux pas travailler", "Blouse du dentiste", etc.) or sweet ballads ("Le loup, la biche et le chevalier", "Syracuse", "Jardin d'hiver").
biography.name: Henri Salvador

biography.bio: This beautiful blonde started in her early twenties as Cécile, a provincial girl who goes to Paris where she becomes a window dresser, in a successful TV serial 'Seule à Paris' (1965). At the same time comedian Jean-Marc Thibault (twenty years older than her) fell in love with her and they have shared their lives ever since. Unfortunately the popular comedies Thibault and his sidekick Roger Pierre starred in were mediocre at best ans as Sophie faithfully followed her companion into these highly forgettable films, her filmography really lacks luster as a result. After retiring as an actress, she metamorphosed into a more ambitious person: she now writes novels and scripts for the small screen and co-directs good quality TV documentaries.
biography.name: Sophie Agacinski

biography.bio: Daniel Crohem was born on December 11, 1925 in Heuringhem, France. He is an actor, known for Paris Belongs to Us (1961), Le Doulos (1963) and Happening (1967).
biography.name: Daniel Crohem

biography.bio: Hélène Duc was born on March 22, 1917 in Bergerac, Dordogne, France as Marcelle Geneviève Hélène Duc. She was an actress and writer, known for Tanguy (2001), I Don't Know Much, But I'll Say Everything (1973) and Une femme sans importance (1968). She was married to René Catroux. She died on November 23, 2014 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Hélène Duc

biography.bio: Gérard Darrieu was born on September 11, 1925 in Arnicourt, Ardennes, France as Gérard Raoul Julien Darrieumerlou. He was an actor, known for My American Uncle (1980), Z (1969) and Elevator to the Gallows (1958). He died on January 22, 2004 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Gérard Darrieu

biography.bio: Jacqueline Jefford is an actress, known for The Troops & Aliens (1979), Ne vous fâchez pas Imogène (1970) and Chronique villageoise (1973).
biography.name: Jacqueline Jefford

biography.bio: Colin Drake was born on March 8, 1917. He was an actor and writer, known for Cast a Deadly Spell (1991), César and Rosalie (1972) and L'affaire Dominici (1973). He died on March 27, 2011 in Auburn, California, USA.
biography.name: Colin Drake

biography.bio: Raymond Jourdan is an actor, known for The Rise of Louis XIV (1966), Une simple histoire (1959) and The Elusive Corporal (1962).
biography.name: Raymond Jourdan

biography.bio: Claude Mansard was born on September 20, 1922 in Paris, France. He was an actor, known for Breathless (1960), The 400 Blows (1959) and Shoot the Piano Player (1960). He died on June 29, 1967 in Paris.
biography.name: Claude Mansard

biography.bio: Henri Labussière was born on March 20, 1921 in Villeneuve-Saint-Georges, Val-de-Marne, France. He was an actor and writer, known for Les aventures de Tintin (1991), The Twelve Tasks of Asterix (1976) and Astérix et le coup du menhir (1989). He died on June 15, 2008 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Henri Labussière

actors.character: M. Pincard - le ministre de l'Intérieur

biography.bio: Bernard Lavalette was born on January 20, 1926 in Paris, France. He is an actor, known for Asterix the Gaul (1967), Asterix and Cleopatra (1968) and The Twelve Tasks of Asterix (1976).
biography.name: Bernard Lavalette
